docs.lead_paragraph: Intensifying their rivalry, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Tuesday accused Bernie Sanders of charting a tax increase on middle-class families and undercutting President Barack Obama's signature health care law. Sanders' campaign shot back that her approach to health care was all about her financial donors.

headline.main: Clinton, Sanders Spar Over Taxes, Health Care
headline.print_headline: Clinton, Sanders Spar Over Taxes, Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: A tiny theater in Chicago is a showcase for a sweeping and deep new work by David Rabe, in powerful form.

headline.main: Review: David Rabe’s ‘Good for Otto’ Introduces a World of Pain
headline.print_headline: The Burden of a World of Pain

docs.abstract: Charles Isherwood reviews premiere of David Rabe play Good For Otto, directed by Michael Patrick Thornton and starring John Gawlik and Lynda Newton, at Gift Theater in Chicago.
docs.snippet: A tiny theater in Chicago is a showcase for a sweeping and deep new work by David Rabe, in powerful form.

docs.lead_paragraph: Striving for better quality and more predictable costs, Medicare on Monday launched a major payment change for hip and knee replacements, the most common inpatient surgery for its 55 million beneficiaries.

docs.lead_paragraph: An incurable disease has given Jose Gonzalez Ortiz the health of an old man at age 42, and the collapsing Puerto Rican health system only adds to his pain.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday rejected an anti-abortion group's bid to force the federal government to reveal more information about a $1 million grant it made in 2011 to women's health provider Planned Parenthood in New Hampshire.

headline.print_headline: Tracking Fitness With Years Adding Up

docs.lead_paragraph: Ben Carson lambastes "Obamacare" as much as the next Republican presidential candidate, but the neurosurgeon-turned-politician has a history of health care ideas that puts him outside mainstream conservative thought on the issue.
